page.title: 05FARMING..HILTON OF BEATH
page.content: Mr Thomson and son work the farm with three other employees. The farm covers 600 acres and is an arable/beef one. Crops are oats - 16 acres wheat 22 acres, roots 10 acres, barley 178 acres, grass 289 acres. A cash crop grown is potatoes, 10 acres. Markets are at Stirling and Perth. The crop rotation is 6 years grain crop and 1 year root crop. All the farm machinery is required for crops. There are 335 beef animals but not any dairy cattle. The cattle are out to grass in summer and are fed turnips, hay and silage in winter. All feed is home grown. Natural and synthetic fertilisers are used.
